Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1
Missing the "why" aspect of the commit message. i.e. Why are you doing this change? And what are the ramifications to the existing design?
Yes will update
Done

There is already discussion in progress to Handle vendor-hw specific    debug data collection. In the proposed approach is also we are trying to get same direction to use PDC only dump management once data is collected. https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/+/71384 got some initial discussion also you can refer the review links added in the comments for more details.

Like High level ODC can be used for dump monitoring and data collection and PDC can use for dump management to serve redfish requests. This approach will help to reduce PDC dependency on  vendor specific code.
In this current code the dump will be collected and collection will be monitored in ODC, but the dump entries needs to be here for bmcweb to access
CreateDump is implemented because user requests come through the bmcweb. This code gets compiled only on the supported systems, and all these changes have no impact on the common dumps.
The commit message doesn't explain to me why we removed the start of this unit. It's where the actual dump was created wasn't it?
Yes I need to explain that in the commit message, all open power dump creation will be outside the scope of this service, so for consitency dump will be started from openpower specific applictaion
Done
Since these commits are IBM specific functions, Required Matt/Devender(ODC Maintainer's) reviews to make sure aligning to proposed internal design flow.
There is a +1 from Matt
Matt's +1 is only for this commit,  am referring all the commits in this chain.
OK, waiting for reviews on other commits.. this cant go independently

The namespace conversion is fairly uninteresting. At a high level, I believe the high level goal here is that PDC is the entry to the dump creation, this plugin within PDC gets notified and creates a basic dump entry, which then will trigger a d-bus event that ODC monitors to go and collect the actual dump? How is the status of the ODC dump progress impact the PDC d-bus object?

Are there any impacts to the existing code that uses this or was it all downstream so nothing to worry about there?

The above items are the things I'd like to see documented in the commit message.

Yes I will update the commit message,
- Resource dump and system dump are upstream, and PLDM is updating their listening path.
- Rest of the dumps which get collected in ODC are downstream
- Once the dump collection is successful, this service will get inotify similar to BMC dump and the status will be updated.
- if the dump collection is failed then the ODC will update the status as failed.
I'm not sure what these constants have to do with `openpower` but can you add them to `paths` in phosphor-dbus-interfaces like Logging.Entry has?
Added path for system https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/+/71946/1

Made a minor change to your commit and merged it.  Please leverage those generated paths here rather than creating hand-coded constants.

(I left one comment about single-host vs multi-host that you can address asynchronously.)
Thanks Patrick, currently only supporting single host in near future
Done
